title: (x) "Fish & Shellfish" serif book face w/ ligatures - Tribute {Angel}
content:
Hi guys,

This is my first post in here. Such an elegant and interesting website for typography. By the way, that any body know which font is that?

[http://www.pixentral.com/show.php?picture=1pigH97tkUcgekEZc4w8pqmShNiTRe](http://web.archive.org/web/20071009211445/http:/www.pixentral.com/show.php?picture=1pigH97tkUcgekEZc4w8pqmShNiTRe "http://www.pixentral.com/show.php?picture=1pigH97tkUcgekEZc4w8pqmShNiTRe")

Very classic look which a beautiful ligature...maybe baskerville? Is the ligature “manipulated”?

Thanks for any help and best!

Sebastiao

 [‹ (x) "A beef patty" hand printed caps - Tekton {Paul}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071009211445/http:/typophile.com/node/33331 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Hastens serif face - Pilgrim (Perpetua) {Angel} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071009211445/http:/typophile.com/node/33321 "Go to next forum topic")
author: uzapucax

comments.content:
Emigre’s Tribute Roman (not the ampersand). sh and other ligatures available.

[http://www.identifont.com/find?font=tribute](http://web.archive.org/web/20071009211445/http:/www.identifont.com/find?font=tribute "http://www.identifont.com/find?font=tribute")

Thanks for the fast reply. The ampersand is very good, I think I saw it somewhere before, but can´t remember.

Best,

Sebastian, the ampersand is included. I just didn’t notice it!

[Tribute Roman Ligatures](http://web.archive.org/web/20071009211445/http:/www.emigre.com/fontpage.php?STrbRL.html)
